sentences: Tegime Aljošaga käreda parve, sidusime pajuvitstega kinni ja purjetasime kõrkjate varju.
See on käre mutt, eit (tüdruku, naise kohta).
context: The word 'tüdruku' in Estonian appears to be part of the phrase 'käreda mutt, eit (tüdruku, naise kohta)' which translates as 'great girl/woman'. In this context, it's used as an exclamation of praise or admiration for a girl or woman. The word 'tüdruku' specifically means 'girl' (in the allative case, indicating direction or towards).
